meanings.definition: A condition in which the skin becomes red and sore as a result of overexposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: After spending too much time at the beach, she got painful sunburns on her shoulders.
meanings.sent2: His sunburns from the picnic made him regret not applying sunscreen.
meanings.sent3: The sunburns on his nose made him look like a ripe tomato.
meanings.sent4: Her sunburns were like a fiery reminder of the summer day's intensity.
meanings.sent5: The bright red sunburns on her back were a harsh lesson in sun safety.

meanings.sent1: If you stay out in the sun too long, you will sunburn.
meanings.sent2: She always forgets to wear a hat and ends up sunburning her face.
meanings.sent3: He managed to sunburn even after applying sunscreen multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The fair-skinned child easily sunburns even on cloudy days.
meanings.sent5: Despite the warnings, he continued to sunburn his skin by not seeking shade.
